tasks.task: Installing a solar irrigation system on a farm
subtasks: Researching the appropriate size and number of solar panels for the system
Choosing the right type of solar-powered pump (surface or submersible) based on water source depth
Considering the purchase of a battery for storing excess energy
Selecting the appropriate piping or drip irrigation system for water distribution
Gathering necessary tools and equipment, including mounting brackets and pipe connectors
Finding a suitable location for the solar panels with maximum sunlight exposure
Mounting the solar panels securely using appropriate brackets
Wiring the solar panels and configuring the connection to the pump
Installing the chosen pump (surface or submersible) near the water source
Connecting the pump to the solar panels or battery
Setting up the irrigation system (drip lines or piping) to deliver water to crops
Testing the entire system for functionality and leaks
Regularly maintaining the system, including cleaning panels and checking pump functionality

tasks.task: Adapting to future advancements in solar irrigation technology
subtasks: Staying informed about new solar irrigation technologies and systems
Sharing knowledge and encouraging other farmers to adopt solar irrigation
